snippet: The move signals that the government is beginning to step back from the extraordinary measures it took over the summer to stop a steep sell-off in the country’s stock markets.
abstract: China's securities regulator will end its moratorium on initial public offerings before end of 2015; will let initial group of  28 companies move forward with new stock market listings.
lead_paragraph: The move signals that the government is beginning to step back from the extraordinary measures it took over the summer to stop a steep sell-off in the country’s stock markets.

headline.main: China Plans to Lift Moratorium on I.P.O.s by End of Year
headline.print_headline: China to Lift Moratorium on I.P.O.s
